comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Scribal error, should be La Forge. "Frank La Forge (Rockford, Illinois, October 22, 1879 – New York, New York, May 5, 1953) was an American pianist and composer and arranger of art songs." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_La_Forge You can hear him playing at www.youtube.com/watch?v=mxYmEblwljA The same person nearby:

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: I wonder why this image was reversed...?

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: It sees to have either been scanned backwards by LOC or accidentally reversed after scanning.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: These 2 photos of La Forge at the piano bear the same date as the adjacent two of station WEAF's announcer Graham McNamee, and were taken in WEAF's New York broadcast studio. On January 15, 1925, the Victor Talking Machine Company sponsored a live broadcast from WEAF of Frank La Forge, opera singer Frances Alda and others, and these 4 pictures were probably taken in connection with that concert. fultonhistory.com/Newspaper%2011/Geneva%20NY%20Daily%20Ti... See notes under

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: B-59, rjones0856 and artolog:  Thanks for pointing out the transcription error.  We'll fix the description next time we update.  We will also link them to the others taken at the same location, and fix the orientation.
